sen.j: 征夷大将軍（せいいたいしょうぐん）は、日本の令外官の将軍職の一つ。
sen.e: Seii Taishogun was one of the Shogun positions in Japan's Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system).
Seii Taishogun was one of the Shogun positions in Japan's Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system).
sen.cmt: Ryoge no kanのイタリックを変更。
sen.e: Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") was one of the Shogun positions in Japan's Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system).
sen.cmt: (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") を追加しました。

sen.j: 明治維新により廃止された。
sen.e: It was abolished in the Meiji Restoration.
It was abolished in the Meiji Restoration.
It was abolished in the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 奈良時代から平安時代には東国に派遣された将軍の呼称の一つであった。
sen.e: It was one of the names given to the general dispatched to the eastern part of the country from the Nara period to the Heian period.
It was one of the names given to the general dispatched to the eastern part of the country from the Nara period to the Heian period.
It was one of the names given to the general dispatched to the eastern part of the country from the Nara period to the Heian period.

sen.j: 略して将軍、公方、大樹、大樹公、御所などとも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Also abbreviated to Shogun, Kubo, Taiju, Taijuko, Gosho, etc.
Also abbreviated to Shogun, Kubo, Taiju, Taijuko, Gosho, etc.
Also abbreviated to Shogun, Kubo, Taiju, Taijuko, Gosho, etc.

sen.j: 征戎大将軍、征蛮大将軍、という名称の職はないが、類似した職に征狄大将軍（せいてきだいしょうぐん）や征西大将軍がある。
sen.e: Although there were no posts called Seiju Taishogun or Seiban Taishogun, there were the similar posts of Seiteki Daishogun and Seisei Taishogun.
Although there were no posts called Seiju Taishogun or Seiban Taishogun, there were the similar posts of Seiteki Daishogun and Seisei Taishogun.
Although there were no posts called Seiju Taishogun or Seiban Taishogun, there were the similar posts of Seiteki Daishogun and Seisei Taishogun.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代以降江戸時代に至るまでは、幕府の長であり、武家の棟梁が位に就いて子孫が世襲する形を取った。
sen.e: From the Kamakura period until the Edo period, it was the head of the Shogunate, a position held by the leader of the samurai families, and became hereditary to his descendants.
From the Kamakura period until the Edo period, it was the head of the Shogunate, a position held by the leader of the samurai families, and became hereditary to his descendants.
From the Kamakura period until the Edo period, it was the head of the Shogunate, a position held by the leader of the samurai families, and became hereditary to his descendants.

sen.j: 形式的には勅令により任命される臣下ではあるが、実質的に朝廷をも押さえた日本の統治者であり、対外的にも国王としての待遇を受けるのが通例であった。
sen.e: Although he was formally a retainer appointed by imperial edict, he was actually the ruler of Japan who even held sway over the imperial court, and typically was treated as the king by outsiders.
Although he was formally a retainer appointed by imperial edict, he was actually the ruler of Japan who even held sway over the Imperial Court, and typically was treated as the king by outsiders.
Although he was formally a retainer appointed by imperial edict, he was in fact the ruler of Japan who even held sway over the Imperial Court, and typically was treated as the king by outsiders.
sen.cmt: actually -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 「征夷」とは、「夷を征討する」の意味。
sen.e: "Seii" means "to conquer the barbarians."
'Seii' means 'to conquer the barbarians.'
sen.cmt: に修正。以下他セルも同様。
sen.e: 'Seii' means 'to conquer the barbarians.'

sen.j: 征夷大将軍は、「夷」征討に際し任命された将軍の一つで、太平洋側から進軍する軍隊を率いた。
sen.e: The Seii Taishogun was a general appointed for conquering "barbarians,"and lead an army in an advance from the Pacific ocean side.
The Seii Taishogun was a general appointed for conquering 'barbarians,' and led an army in an advance from the Pacific Ocean side.
The Seii Taishogun was a general appointed for conquering 'barbarians,' and led an army in an advance from the Pacific Ocean side.

sen.j: 日本海側を進軍する軍隊を率いる将軍は征狄大将軍、九州へ進軍する軍隊を率いる将軍は征西大将軍と呼ぶ。
sen.e: A general who lead an army's advance to the Japan Sea side was called Seii Taishogun, and one who lead an army's advance into Kyushu was called Seisei Taishogun.
A general who led an army's advance to the Japan Sea side was called Seiteki Daishogun, and one who led an army's advance into Kyushu was called Seisei Taishogun.
A general who led an army's advance to the Japan Sea side was called Seiteki Daishogun, and one who led an army's advance into Kyushu was called Seisei Taishogun.

sen.j: これは、「東夷・西戎・南蛮・北狄」と呼ぶ、中華思想の「四夷」をあてはめたためと思われる。
sen.e: It is thought that this was an adaptation of the Chinese concept of "Shii" (four barbarians), "toi, seiju, nanban and hokuteki."
It is thought that this was an adaptation of the Sinocentrism of 'Shii' (four barbarians), 'toi, seiju, nanban and hokuteki.'
sen.cmt: 中華思想→Sinocentrism 用語集その他より""→ ''
sen.e: It is thought that this was an adaptation of the Sinocentrism of 'Shii' (four barbarians), 'toi, seiju, namban and hokuteki.'

sen.j: なお、当初は「征夷」と呼ばれていたが、宝亀以降「征東」となり、延暦12年以降再び「征夷」となる。
sen.e: Actually, at first it was called "Seii" but from Hoki onward it became "Seito," and was again called "Seii" from 893 on.
Actually, at first it was called 'Seii' but from Hoki onward it became 'Seito,' and was again called 'Seii' from 793 on.
In fact, at first it was called 'Seii' but from Hoki onward it became 'Seito,' and was again called 'Seii' from 793 on.

sen.j: 「征夷将軍」の初見は、養老4年9月29日に任命された、多治比縣守であり、「征東大将軍」の初見は、延暦7年12月7日に辞見した紀古佐美である。
sen.e: The first "Seii Shogun" was appointed on September 29, 720, and was Tahiji Agatamori; the first "Seito Taishogun" was appointed on December 7, 793, and was KI no Kosami.
The first 'Seii Shogun' was appointed on September 29, 720, and was Tajihi Agatamori; the first 'Seito Taishogun' was appointed on December 7, 788, and was KI no Kosami.
sen.cmt: ""→ ''Tajihi agatamoriに修正。793→788 参照 : http://www.sunfield.ne.jp/~inokuras/seireki1.htm その他
sen.e: The first 'Seii Shogun' was appointed on September 29, 720, and was Tajihi Agatamori; the first 'Seito Taishogun' was appointed on December 7, 788, and was KI no Kosami.

sen.j: 将軍の名称は、記録上あまり統一されておらず、例えば藤原宇合の場合は、任命時は「持節大将軍」であり、帰京時は「征夷持節大使」となっている。
sen.e: The title of Shogun is not uniform in the records, with FUJIWARA no Umakai, for example, being "Jisetsu Taishogun" at the time of his appointment, and "Seii Jisetsu Taishi" at the time of his return to the Capital.

The title of Shogun is not uniform in the records, with FUJIWARA no Umakai, for example, being 'Jisetsu Taishogun' at the time of his appointment, and 'Seii Jisetsu Taishi' at the time of his return to the Capital.

The title of Shogun is not uniform in the records, with FUJIWARA no Umakai, for example, being 'Jisetsu Taishogun' at the time of his appointment, and 'Seii Jisetsu Taishi' at the time of his return to the Capital.

sen.j: 延暦10年（791年）7月13日に、大伴弟麻呂が征東大使に任命された。
sen.e: On July 13, 790, OTOMO no Otomaro was appointed Seito Taishi.
On July 13, 791, OTOMO no Otomaro was appointed Seito Taishi.
sen.cmt: 790→791 参照 : http://www.sunfield.ne.jp/~inokuras/seireki1.htm その他 ※原文間違いの為訂正。
sen.e: On July 13, 791, OTOMO no Otomaro was appointed Seito Taishi.

sen.j: 延暦12年（793年）2月17日に、征東使を征夷使と改めた。
sen.e: On February 17, 792, Seitoshi was changed to Seiishi.
On February 17, 793, Seitoshi was changed to Seiishi.
sen.cmt: 792→793 参照 : http://www.sunfield.ne.jp/~inokuras/seireki1.htm その他 ※原文間違いの為訂正。
sen.e: On February 17, 793, Seitoshi was changed to Seiishi.

sen.j: 「使」はまた「将軍」とも呼ばれており、これが征夷大将軍の初見とする考えもあるが、なお問題は複雑である。
sen.e: "Shi" was also called "Shogun," and one school of thought says this is the first appearance of a Seii Taishogun, but the issue gets more complicated.
'Shi' was also called 'Shogun,' and one school of thought says this is the first appearance of a Seii Taishogun, but the issue gets more complicated.
'Shi' was also called 'Shogun,' and one school of thought says this is the first appearance of a Seii Taishogun, but the issue gets more complicated.

sen.j: 大伴弟麻呂の下で征東副使・征夷副使だった坂上田村麻呂は、延暦16年（797年）11月5日に征夷大将軍に任命された。
sen.e: Below OTOMO no Otomaro was the Seito Fukushi/Seii Fukushi, SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, who was appointed Seii Taishogun on November 5, 797.
Below OTOMO no Otomaro was the Seito Fukushi/Seii Fukushi, SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, who was appointed Seii Taishogun on November 5, 797.
Below OTOMO no Otomaro was the Seito Fukushi/Seii Fukushi, SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, who was appointed Seii Taishogun on November 5, 797.

sen.j: 田村麻呂はそれまで頑強に戦ってきた胆沢の蝦夷のアテルイを京へ連れ帰り、その地を征服した。
sen.e: Tamuramaro brought Aterui, of the Ezo of Isawa, who had fought stubbornly until then, back to the capital, thereby conquering that land.
Tamuramaro brought Aterui, of the Ezo of Isawa, who had fought stubbornly until then, back to the capital, thereby conquering that land.
Tamuramaro brought Aterui, of the Ezo of Isawa, who had fought stubbornly until then, back to the capital, thereby conquering that land.

sen.j: 実質的な意味では、田村麻呂が初代征夷大将軍とも考えられる。
sen.e: Practically speaking, Tamuramaro can be seen as the first Seii Taishogun.
Practically speaking, Tamuramaro can be seen as the first Seii Taishogun.
Practically speaking, Tamuramaro can be seen as the first Seii Taishogun.

sen.j: その後文室綿麻呂が、蝦夷との交戦に際して弘仁2年（811年）4月17日に「大」なしの征夷将軍に任命され、同年 閏12月11日 蝦夷征伐の終了を奏上、鎮守将軍（府なし）には副将軍だった物部足継が昇格、しかし、弘仁5年（814年）11月17日には、また「大」なしの征夷将軍に復帰している。
sen.e: Later, on April 17 of 811, during a battle with the Ezo, FUNYA no Watamaro was appointed Seii Shogun, without the "tai," and on December 11 of that year reported the end of the conquest of the Ezo, and MONONOBE no Taritsugu, who had been Fukushogun, rose to Chinjuf Shogun (without the "fu"), but on November 17, 814, became again Seii Shogun without the "tai."

Later, on April 17 of 811, during a battle with the Ezo, FUNYA no Watamaro was appointed Seii Shogun, without the 'tai,' and on December 11 of that year reported the end of the conquest of the Ezo, and MONONOBE no Taritsugu, who had been Fukushogun, rose to Chinju Shogun (without the 'fu'), but on November 17, 814, became again Seii Shogun without the 'tai.'
sen.cmt: ""→ '' 原文間違い、鎮守府将軍→鎮守将軍に訂正。Chinjuf→Chinju
sen.e: Later, on April 17 of 811, during a battle with the Ezo, FUNYA no Watamaro was appointed Seii Shogun, without the 'tai,' and on December 11 of that year reported the end of the conquest of the Ezo, and MONONOBE no Taritsugu, who had been Fukushogun, rose to Chinju Shogun (without the 'fu'), but on November 17, 814, became again Seii Shogun without the 'tai.'

sen.j: なお、征夷大将軍の下には征夷副将軍、征夷軍監、征夷軍曹などの役職が置かれた。
sen.e: Actually, below the Seii Taishogun were the posts of Seii Fukushogun, Seii Gungen, Seii Gunso, etc.
Actually, below the Seii Taishogun were the posts of Seii Fukushogun, Seii Gungen, Seii Gunso, etc.
In fact, below the Seii Taishogun were the posts of Seii Fukushogun, Seii Gungen, Seii Gunso, etc.

sen.j: 源頼朝は当初、関東武士団の棟梁（＝鎌倉殿）でしかなく、律令制下における地位を持たなかった。
sen.e: At first MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was nothing but the leader of the Kanto Bushidan (Kanto-dono), and did not hold a position under the Ritsuryo system.
At first MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was nothing but the leader of the Kanto Bushidan (Kamakura-dono), and did not hold a position under the Ritsuryo system.
At first MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was nothing but the leader of the Kanto Bushidan (Kamakura-dono), and did not hold a position under the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 即ち、当初は平将門等と同じ地方叛乱の首領でしかなかったのである。
sen.e: That is to say that at first he was only the head of a provincial insurrection, the sae as TAIRA no Masakado.
That is to say that at first he was only the head of a provincial insurrection, the same as TAIRA no Masakado.
That is to say that at first he was only the head of a provincial insurrection, the same as TAIRA no Masakado.

sen.j: その頼朝の政権構想には、先行モデルとして平家政権・木曾義仲・奥州藤原地方政権の3パターンがあり、それらの比較検討から次第に鎌倉政権のイメージが練られたと思われる。
sen.e: That same Yoritomo's plan for a new government used as models the three governments of the Taira family, KISO Yoshinaka, and the provincial government of the Oshu Fujiwara clan, and it is thought that the form of the Kamakura government was molded out of comparative consideration of these.

That same Yoritomo's plan for a new government used as models the three governments of the Taira family, KISO Yoshinaka, and the provincial government of the Oshu Fujiwara clan, and it is thought that the form of the Kamakura government was molded out of comparative consideration of these.

That same Yoritomo's plan for a new government used as models the three governments of the Taira family, KISO Yoshinaka, and the provincial government of the Oshu Fujiwara clan, and it is thought that the form of the Kamakura government was molded out of comparative consideration of these.

sen.j: 平家政権の段階では、元々当時は公家の地位が高かったため、平氏の中の平家は公家の一つになることで栄華を誇った。
sen.e: At the time of the Taira family's government, because the position of court nobles was very high, they boasted of their majesty when the Taira family, part of the Taira clan, became court nobles.
At the time of the Taira family's government, because the position of court nobles was very high, they boasted of their majesty when the Taira family, part of the Taira clan, became court nobles.

Under the administration led by the Taira family, given that the position of court noble was already very high at the time, court nobles reached the height of their powers when the Taira family, part of the Taira clan, became court nobles.
sen.cmt: " in the social background" doesn't really make much sense to me so I have deleted it.

sen.j: これに対し頼朝は武士の地位そのものの向上に向けて動き出した。
sen.e: In contrast to that, Yoritomo worked toward elevating the status of warriors themselves.
In contrast to that, Yoritomo worked toward elevating the status of warriors themselves.
In contrast to that, Yoritomo worked toward elevating the status of warriors themselves.

sen.j: そこで、朝廷に対して、武士の自主的統治権を確立するために相応の地位を求めていくようになる。
sen.e: With respect to the imperial court, they sought a suitable position in order to establish the independent sovereignty of the warriors.
With respect to the Imperial Court, they sought a suitable position in order to establish the independent sovereignty of the warriors.
With respect to the Imperial Court, they sought a suitable position in order to establish the independent sovereignty of the warriors.

sen.j: 中央・京都に進出した木曾義仲は、過去に存在した「征夷大将軍」という官職に任官した。
sen.e: KISO Yoshinaka, who advanced into the central area and Kyoto, took the position called "Seii Taishogu," which had previously existed.
KISO Yoshinaka, who advanced into the central area and Kyoto, took the position called 'Seii Taishogun,' which had previously existed.
Yoshinaka KISO, who advanced into the central area and Kyoto, took the position called 'Seii Taishogun,' which had previously existed.
sen.cmt: 姓名の順番入れ替え（用語リストミス）

sen.j: 征夷大将軍の地位は東方の勢力を成敗する使命を暗示するもので、その裏には義仲の頼朝に対抗する意図が推定されるが、義仲政権はごく短期の政権に終わった（ただし近年では、義仲が任官したのは「征夷大将軍」ではなく、「征東大将軍」とする説が有力となっている。
sen.e: The position of Seii Taishogun had a hint of a mission to punish the eastern forces, and Yoshinaka's hidden intent to oppose Yoritomo has been surmised from that, but the Yoshinaka government was over very shortly (actually, in recent years the story that says Yoshinaka was not "Seii Taishogun" but "Seito Taishogun" is gaining ground.

The position of Seii Taishogun had a hint of a mission to punish the eastern forces, and Yoshinaka's hidden intent to oppose Yoritomo has been surmised from that, but the Yoshinaka government was over very shortly (actually, in recent years the story that says Yoshinaka was not 'Seii Taishogun' but 'Seito Taishogun' is gaining ground.

The position of Seii Taishogun had a hint of a mission to punish the eastern forces, and Yoshinaka's hidden intent to oppose Yoritomo has been surmised from that, but the Yoshinaka government was over very shortly (in fact, in recent years the story that says Yoshinaka was not 'Seii Taishogun' but 'Seito Taishogun' is gaining ground.

sen.j: 「征夷大将軍」としているのは後世の編纂史料である『吾妻鏡』や『百錬抄』だが、同時代の史料である『玉葉』や『三槐荒涼抜書要』〔『山槐記』の抄出〕では「征東大将軍」となっている。
sen.e: It is the later compilations such as Azuma Kagami and Hyakurensho that have him as Seii Taishogun, but Gyokuyo and Sankaikoryonukigakiyo (excerpts from Sankaiki), from the same era, have it as Seito Taishogun.

It is the later compilations such as "Azuma Kagami" and "Hyakurensho" that have him as 'Seii Taishogun,' but "Gyokuyo" and "Sankaikoryonukigakiyo" (excerpts from "Sankaiki"), from the same era, have it as 'Seito Taishogun.'

It is the later compilations such as "Azuma Kagami" and "Hyakurensho" that give him the title 'Seii Taishogun,' while "Gyokuyo" and "Sankaikoryonukigakiyo" (excerpts from "Sankaiki"), historical documents that were written at the time these events took place, have his title as 'Seito Taishogun.'
sen.cmt: コンマの使い方等を修正しました。

sen.j: また、坂東の頼朝を征伐する官職としては、奥羽の蝦夷を征伐する「征夷大将軍」よりも、かつて坂東の平将門を征伐するために藤原忠文が任官した「征東大将軍」のほうがふさわしいとも考えられる。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is thought that, as a post that would conquer Yoritomo of Bando, Seito Taishogun, a post previously taken by FUJIWARA no Tadabumi to conquer TAIRA no Masakado of Bando, was better than Seii Taishogun, which conquered the Ezo of Ou).

Furthermore, it is thought that, as a post that would conquer Yoritomo of Bando, 'Seito Taishogun,' a post previously taken by FUJIWARA no Tadabumi to conquer TAIRA no Masakado of Bando, was better than 'Seii Taishogun,' which conquered the Ezo of Ou.

Furthermore, it is thought that, as a post that would conquer Yoritomo of Bando, 'Seito Taishogun,' a post previously taken by FUJIWARA no Tadabumi to conquer TAIRA no Masakado of Bando, was better than 'Seii Taishogun,' which conquered the Ezo of Ou.

sen.j: 当時の東北地方は奥州藤原氏が支配し、朝廷の支配が及んでいない地域だった。
sen.e: The Oshu Fujiwara clan ruled the northeast region at that time, as it was an area to which the imperial court's rule did not extend.
The Oshu Fujiwara clan ruled the northeast region at that time, as it was an area to which the Imperial Court's rule did not extend.
The Oshu Fujiwara clan ruled the northeast region at that time, as it was an area to which the Imperial Court's rule did not extend.

sen.j: 奥州藤原氏は「鎮守府将軍」の地位を獲得し自らの居所を「柳の御所」「柳営」と称した。
sen.e: The Oshu Fujiwara clan secured the position of "Chinjufu Shogun" and called their own residence "Yanagi no Gosho" or "Ryuei."
The Oshu Fujiwara clan secured the position of 'Chinjufu Shogun' and called their own residence 'Yanagi no Gosho' or 'Ryuei.'
The Oshu Fujiwara clan secured the position of 'Chinjufu Shogun' and called their own residence 'Yanagi no Gosho' or 'Ryuei.'

sen.j: 柳営とは幕府の別名である。
sen.e: Ryuei is another name for the Shogunate.
Ryuei is another name for the Shogunate.
Ryuei is another name for the Shogunate.

sen.j: 鎮守府将軍は、陸奥国、出羽国内で軍政という形での地方統治権が与えられており辺境常備軍（征夷大将軍の場合は臨時遠征軍）の司令官という性格を持つが故に京都在住の必要が無く、地方政権の首領には都合が良かった。
sen.e: The Chinjufu Shogun was granted regional autonomy in the form of military rule within Mutsu and Dewa Provinces, and as that was formally an officer over the borderland standing army (in the case of Seii Taishogu it was a temporary expeditionary force) it was not necessary to live in Kyoto, and so was convenient for a regional boss.

The Chinjufu Shogun was granted regional autonomy in the form of military rule within Mutsu and Dewa Provinces, and as that was formally an officer over the borderland standing army (in the case of Seii Taishogun it was a temporary expeditionary force) it was not necessary to live in Kyoto, and so was convenient for a regional boss.

The Chinjufu Shogun was granted regional autonomy in the form of military rule within Mutsu Province and Dewa Province, and as this position was formally one of an officer commanding the standing army on the border (in the case of the Seii Taishogun, it was commanding a temporary expeditionary force), it was not necessary for the holder of this title to live in Kyoto, which was very convenient for a regional leader.
sen.cmt: This needed much more correction than just editing the use of commas. Please check.

sen.j: これは頼朝政権の格好の雛形となったろう。
sen.e: This seems to have been the Yoritomo government in microcosm.
This seems to have been the Yoritomo government in microcosm.
This seems to have been the Yoritomo government in microcosm.

sen.j: 1190年、頼朝は、右近衛大将（右大将）に任官され、自らの家政機関を政所として公認された。
sen.e: In 1190 Yoritomo was appointed to Ukone no Daisho (Udaisho) and had his own organs of household government approved as government offices.
In 1190 Yoritomo was appointed to Ukone no Daisho (Udaisho) and had his own organs of household government approved as government offices.
In 1190 Yoritomo was appointed to Ukone no Daisho (Udaisho) and had his own organs of household government approved as government offices.

sen.j: しかし近衛大将はその職務の性格上京都に在住しなければならず、関東での独立を指向するには不向きだった。
sen.e: However, the Konoe Daisho was required, by the nature of that position, to live in Kyoto, and was not suited to moving toward independence in Kanto.
However, the Konoe Daisho was required, by the nature of that position, to live in Kyoto, and was not suited to moving toward independence in Kanto.
However, the Konoe Daisho was required, by the nature of that position, to live in Kyoto, and was not suited to moving toward independence in Kanto.

sen.j: そこで頼朝は右大将を辞任し、前右大将としてその特権を保持した。
sen.e: Then Yoritomo resigned from Udaisho, and held onto those privileges as a former Udaisho.
Then Yoritomo resigned from Udaisho, and held onto those privileges as a former Udaisho.
Then Yoritomo resigned from Udaisho, and held onto those privileges as a former Udaisho.

sen.j: 「前右大将」という名目を鎌倉政権の歴代首長の地位としていく構想もありえなくはなかったと思われる。
sen.e: It is thought that the notion of using the title of "former Udaisho" for heads of state in the Kamakura government was not unheard of.
It is thought that the notion of using the title of 'former Udaisho' for heads of state in the Kamakura government was not unheard of.
It is thought that the notion of using the title of 'former Udaisho' for heads of state in the Kamakura government was not unheard of.

sen.j: だが、右大将では形式上の官位こそ高いが、すでにライバルだった木曾義仲が征夷大将軍（または征東大将軍）だったことに比べると、中央近衛軍司令官という性格上、積極的に地方の争乱を武力で鎮圧する地位ではない。
sen.e: However, although the formal position of the post of Udaisho was high, compared to the rival KISO Yoshinaka, who was Seii Taishogun (or Seito Taishogun), as it was an officer of the central imperial guards, it was not a position for actively suppressing regional disturbances with military force.

However, although the formal position of the post of Udaisho was high, compared to the rival KISO Yoshinaka, who was Seii Taishogun (or Seito Taishogun), as it was an officer of the central imperial guards, it was not a position for actively suppressing regional disturbances with military force.

However, although the formal position of the post of Udaisho was high, compared to the rival KISO Yoshinaka, who was Seii Taishogun (or Seito Taishogun), as it was an officer of the central imperial guards, it was not a position for actively suppressing regional disturbances with military force.

sen.j: また奥州藤原氏の鎮守府将軍と比較すると「武士の自治」という重要な積極的要素が欠けていた。
sen.e: Also, compared to the Oshu Fujiwara clan's Chinjufu Shogun, it lacked the important, active element of warrior's self-rule.
Also, compared to the Oshu Fujiwara clan's Chinjufu Shogun, it lacked the important, active element of 'warrior's self-rule.'
Also, compared to the Oshu Fujiwara clan's Chinjufu Shogun, it lacked the important, active element of 'warrior's self-rule.'

sen.j: そこで頼朝が注目したのが「征夷大将軍」という官職であった。
sen.e: What Yoritomo turned his attention to then was the office of "Seii Taishogun."
What Yoritomo turned his attention to then was the office of 'Seii Taishogun.'
What Yoritomo turned his attention to then was the office of 'Seii Taishogun.'

sen.j: これは軍政（地方統治権）という意味では鎮守府将軍と同様である。
sen.e: As military rule (regional sovereignty), it was the same as the Chinjufu Shogun.
As military rule (regional sovereignty), it was the same as the Chinjufu Shogun.
As military rule (regional sovereignty), it was the same as the Chinjufu Shogun.

sen.j: かつ、坂東の兵（この場合は東国の武士）を率いて奥羽の蝦夷（この場合は奥州藤原氏）を征伐するという目的からしても、鎮守府将軍より故実からして格上でもある格好の官職であった。
sen.e: Moreover,with the goal in mind of leading the Bando soldiers (in this case, warriors from eastern Japan) in victory over the Ezo of Oshu (in this case, the Oshu Fujiwara clan), it was in practice a post superior to Chinjufu Shogun.

Moreover, with the goal in mind of leading the Bando soldiers (in this case, warriors from eastern Japan) in victory over the Ezo of Ou (in this case, the Oshu Fujiwara clan), it was in practice a post superior to Chinjufu Shogun.
sen.cmt: withの前のスペースを調整。Oshu→Ou
sen.e: However, given that the goal of this position was to lead the Bando soldiers (in this case, warriors from eastern Japan) to victory over the Ezo of Ou (in this case, the Oshu Fujiwara clan), it was traditionally a post superior to that of Chinjufu Shogun.
sen.cmt: The edited version doesn't seem to make much more sense to me than the original translation (which was very chokuyaku), I have rewritten it. Please check.

sen.j: つまり、東国武士の棟梁として君臨する鎌倉殿という私的地位・守護・地頭を全国に置き、軍事警察権を行使する権限右大将として認知された、家政機関を政所などの公的な政治機関に準ずる扱いを受ける権限を、全て纏め上げて公的に担保するのが征夷大将軍職であった。
sen.e: To put it another way, the Seii Taishogun was the one who placed private regents or lords called Kamakura-dono to rule as leaders of the warriors of eastern Japan, was recognized as Udaisho with the authority to exercise military police powers, had family organs of clan governance treated the same as official government offices, and bundled it all together and officially secured it.

To put it another way, the Seii Taishogun was the one who placed a private position called Kamakura-dono to rule as a leader of the warriors of eastern Japan, Shugo and Jito throughout the country, was recognized as Udaisho with the authority to exercise military police powers, had family organs of clan governance treated the same as official government offices, and bundled it all together and officially secured it.
sen.cmt: 守護→Shugo地頭→Jito※原文の、私的地位の後の"・"が抜けていた為、英訳に勘違いあり。前半訂正。
sen.e: To put it another way, the Seii Taishogun was the one who placed a private position called Kamakura-dono to rule as a leader of the warriors of eastern Japan, Shugo and Jito throughout the country, was recognized as Udaisho with the authority to exercise military police powers, had family organs of clan governance treated the same as official government offices, and bundled it all together and officially secured it.

sen.j: ただし征夷大将軍職は奥州藤原氏を討つための奥州合戦においてこそ必要とされた官職であって、実際に任官した1192年においては、既に頼朝にとって必要性はなくなっていたという説も有力である。
sen.e: However, there is reason to believe that the post of Seii Taishogun was deemed necessary especially in the Oshu War to defeat the Oshu Fujiwara clan, and when he was actually appointed in 1192 it had already lost its importance to Yoritomo.

However, there is reason to believe that the post of Seii Taishogun was deemed necessary especially in the Oshu War to defeat the Oshu Fujiwara clan, and when he was actually appointed in 1192 it had already lost its importance to Yoritomo.

However, there is reason to believe that the post of Seii Taishogun was deemed necessary especially in the Oshu War to defeat the Oshu Fujiwara clan, and when he was in fact appointed in 1192 it had already lost its importance to Yoritomo.

sen.j: 実際に頼朝は征夷大将軍職にあまり固執しておらず、２年後の1194年には辞官の意向を示している。
sen.e: Yoritomo was not actually very attached to the Seii Taishogun post, and indicated his intent to resign 2 years later in 1194.
Yoritomo was not actually very attached to the Seii Taishogun post, and indicated his intent to resign 2 years later in 1194.
Yoritomo was not in fact very attached to the Seii Taishogun post, and indicated his intent to resign 2 years later in 1194.

sen.j: また源頼家は家督継承にあたりまず左近衛中将、ついで左衛門督に任官されており、征夷大将軍職を宣下されたのはその３年後である。
sen.e: Also, MINAMOTO no Yoriie was his heir and right away was appointed to Sakone no Chujo, and then Saemon no Kami, and was proclaimed Seii Taishogun 3 years later.
Also, MINAMOTO no Yoriie was his heir and right away was appointed to Sakone no Chujo, and then Saemon no Kami, and was proclaimed Seii Taishogun 3 years later.
Also, MINAMOTO no Yoriie was his heir and right away was appointed to Sakone no Chujo, and then Saemon no Kami, and was proclaimed Seii Taishogun 3 years later.

sen.j: さらに比企能員の変に際しては総追撫使・総地頭の地位の継承が問題となっており、将軍職は対象とされていない。
sen.e: Then at the time of the HIKI Yoshikazu Incident, the succession of the positions of Sotsuibushi and Sojito were in question, and the Shogun posts were not involved.
Then at the time of the HIKI Yoshikazu Incident, the succession of the positions of Sotsuibushi and Sojito were in question, and the Shogun posts were not involved.
Then at the time of the HIKI Yoshikazu Incident, the succession of the positions of Sotsuibushi and Sojito were in question, and the Shogun posts were not involved.

sen.j: したがって、この段階では将軍職は、武家の棟梁の絶対条件ではなく、さほど重視されていなかったことがうかがえる。
sen.e: Consequently, at this stage the Shogun post was not an absolute requirement for leadership of the warrior families, and may not have been seen as that important.
Consequently, at this stage the Shogun post was not an absolute requirement for leadership of the warrior families, and may not have been seen as that important.
Consequently, at this stage the Shogun post was not an absolute requirement for leadership of the warrior families, and may not have been seen as that important.

sen.j: 一方、源実朝の家督継承に際してはまず将軍職が宣下されている。
sen.e: On the other hand, the post of Shogun was proclaimed first when it came to succeeding MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
On the other hand, the post of Shogun was proclaimed first when it came to succeeding MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
On the other hand, the post of Shogun was proclaimed first when it came to succeeding MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.

sen.j: 源氏の征夷大将軍が3代で断絶すると、摂家将軍、宮将軍を傀儡に据えて執権北条氏が実権を握ることになった。
sen.e: When the Minamoto clan's Shoguns ended after the 3rd one, Shoguns from regent families or royal Shoguns were installed as puppets and the regent Hojo clan held the real power.
When the Minamoto clan's Shoguns ended after the 3rd one, Shoguns from regent families or royal Shoguns were installed as puppets and the regent Hojo clan held the real power.
When the Minamoto clan's Shoguns ended after the third one, Shoguns from regent families or royal Shoguns were installed as puppets and the regent Hojo clan held the real power.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代以降、源頼朝が「征夷大将軍」の位を得て幕府を開いてのちは、武家が日本の政治を支配するようになった。
sen.e: From the Kamakura period on, after MINAMOTO no Yoritomo took the position of Seii Taishogun and started the Shogunate, the warrior families came to control Japanese politics.
From the Kamakura period on, after MINAMOTO no Yoritomo took the position of Seii Taishogun and started the Shogunate, the warrior families came to control Japanese politics.
From the Kamakura period on, after MINAMOTO no Yoritomo took the position of Seii Taishogun and started the Shogunate, the warrior families came to control Japanese politics.

sen.j: それにともない「征夷大将軍」は武家の最高権威であり、日本の実質的な君主となった。
sen.e: Along with that Seii Taishogun was the highest authority of the warrior families and Japan's substantive sovereign.
Along with that Seii Taishogun was the highest authority of the warrior families and Japan's substantive sovereign.
Along with that Seii Taishogun was the highest authority of the warrior families and Japan's substantive sovereign.

sen.j: 元々は朝廷が与える官職だが、実際の任命は、建武の新政の時期を除いて実力で武家の頂点に立った者の要請によった。
sen.e: Although it was originally a post bestowed by the imperial court, actual appointments, except for a time during the New Kenmu Government, were at the request of the person whose influence placed him at the pinnacle of samurai society.

Although it was originally a post bestowed by the Imperial Court, actual appointments, except for a time during the New Kemmu Government, were at the request of the person whose influence placed him at the pinnacle of samurai society.

Although it was originally a post bestowed by the Imperial Court, actual appointments, except for a time during the New Kemmu Government, were at the request of the person whose influence placed him at the pinnacle of samurai society.

sen.j: 形式的に言えば、朝廷が正規の政府で幕府は地方における臨時の政府であると公家の間では認識していた。
sen.e: Formally speaking, among the nobles it was recognized that the court was the true government and the Shogunate was a temporary government in the provinces.
Formally speaking, among the nobles it was recognized that the Court was the true government and the Shogunate was a temporary government in the provinces.
Formally speaking, among the nobles it was recognized that the Court was the true government and the Shogunate was a temporary government in the provinces.

sen.j: だが、武家の間ではそうであるとは限らなかった。
sen.e: However, among warrior families that was not the case.
However, among warrior families that was not the case.

sen.j: 南北朝時代には、南朝の北畠顕家が鎮守府将軍を鎮守大将軍と名乗ることを認められているが、これは征夷大将軍と同格の存在としてこれに対抗する意図があったとされる。
sen.e: In the Northern and Southern Courts period, KITABATAKE Akiie of the Southern Court, as Chinjufu Shogun, was allowed to be called Chinjufu Taishogun, but it is thought that this was done to put it on a level with and oppose the Seii Taishogun.

In the Northern and Southern Courts period, KITABATAKE Akiie of the Southern Court, as Chinjufu Shogun, was allowed to be called Chinjufu Taishogun, but it is thought that this was done to put it on a level with and oppose the Seii Taishogun.

sen.j: 歴史上存在した俗説
sen.e: Historical Traditions
Historical Traditions
Historical Traditions

sen.j: 「武家の棟梁となる将軍に就く家柄は、清和源氏に連なる家系に限る」という認識が武家の間でまことしやかに慣例となっていた。
sen.e: It was customarily accepted by the warrior families that the families that could rise to Shogun, leader of the samurai, were limited to those extending from the Seiwa Genji.
It was customarily accepted by the warrior families that 'the families that could rise to Shogun, leader of the samurai, were limited to those extending from the Seiwa Genji.'
It was customarily accepted by the warrior families that 'the families that could rise to Shogun, leader of the samurai, were limited to those extending from the Seiwa Genji.'

sen.j: 織田信長は織田家が平家の系図を称していたため「征夷大将軍」にはなれず、また徳川家康は「征夷大将軍」に任命されるに当たっては、系図を偽造して清和源氏と称したというエピソードも残っている。
sen.e: Because the Oda family claimed a connection with the Taira family, ODA Nobunaga was not able to become Seii Taishogun; and when TOKUGAWA Ieyasu was appointed Seii Taishogun, he falsified a connection to the Seiwa Minamoto clan; and there are other such tales.

Because the Oda family claimed a connection with the Taira family, Nobunaga ODA was not able to become 'Seii Taishogun'; and when TOKUGAWA Ieyasu was appointed 'Seii Taishogun,' he falsified a connection to the Seiwa Minamoto clan; and there are other such tales.

Because the Oda family claimed a connection with the Taira family, Nobunaga ODA was not able to become 'Seii Taishogun'; and when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was appointed 'Seii Taishogun,' he falsified a connection to the Seiwa Minamoto clan; and there are other such tales.
sen.cmt: 姓名の順番入れ替え（リストミス）

sen.j: しかしながら、実際に織田信長に「征夷大将軍拝命」の勧めの勅使が来ていることもあり、現実的には源氏でなければ将軍になれないというのは根拠がない（おそらく家康が源氏を称した理由はただ将軍になるのではなく、源氏長者となり、さらに将軍職へ就くことにより、秀吉の武家関白制に対抗し、武家と公家の双方を支配する権利を得るのが目的だったのであろう）。
sen.e: However, ODA Nobunaga actually received an imperial recommendation for appointment to Seii Taishogun, so realistically there was no basis for the idea that one could not be Shogun if he was not from the Minamoto clan (it seems that the reason Ieyasu claimed Minamoto heritage was not only to become Shogun, but that by becoming the Minamoto clan chief and entering the post of Shogun, he would oppose Hideyoshi's warrior Kanpaku system and aimed to gain authority to rule over both the warriors and the nobles).

However, Nobunaga ODA actually received an imperial recommendation for 'appointment to Seii Taishogun,' so realistically there was no basis for the idea that one could not be Shogun if he was not from the Minamoto clan (it seems that the reason Ieyasu claimed Minamoto heritage was not only to become Shogun, but that by becoming the Minamoto clan chief and entering the post of Shogun, he would oppose Hideyoshi's warrior Kanpaku system and aimed to gain authority to rule over both the warriors and the nobles).

However, Nobunaga ODA in fact received an imperial recommendation for 'appointment to Seii Taishogun,' so realistically there was no basis for the idea that one could not be Shogun if he was not from the Minamoto clan (it seems that the reason Ieyasu claimed Minamoto heritage was not only to become Shogun, but that by becoming the Minamoto clan chief and entering the post of Shogun, he would oppose Hideyoshi's warrior Kampaku system and aimed to gain authority to rule over both the warriors and the nobles).
sen.cmt: Kanpaku→Kampaku "actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: また、頼朝以降に限っても、摂家将軍や皇族将軍の例があり、現実に清和源氏に限られていない。
sen.e: Furthermore, even after Yoritomo, there are examples of regent Shogun and imperial Shogun, so it was not actually limited to the Seiwa Minamoto clan.
Furthermore, even after Yoritomo, there are examples of regent Shogun and imperial Shogun, so it was not actually limited to the Seiwa Minamoto clan.
Furthermore, even after Yoritomo, there are examples of regent Shogun and imperial Shogun, so it was not in fact limited to the Seiwa Minamoto clan.

sen.j: これらの事から、征夷大将軍になるのは源氏でも平氏でも、さらには公家の藤原氏でもなんら支障は無いと解釈できる。
sen.e: All this can be interpreted to mean that someone from the Minamoto or Taira clans, or even from the noble Fujiwara clan, could become Seii Taishogun.
All this can be interpreted to mean that someone from the Minamoto or Taira clans, or even from the noble Fujiwara clan, could become Seii Taishogun.
All this can be interpreted to mean that someone from the Minamoto or Taira clans, or even from the noble Fujiwara clan, could become Seii Taishogun.

sen.j: そこで昨今取りざたされている説は、「征夷大将軍」は本来東国の兵を率いて蝦夷征伐にあたる職なので、「何らかの形で東国を抑えている者」が就任するための条件であったというものである。
sen.e: A recently popular explanation on the subject is that, since Seii Taishogun was originally a post for leading soldiers of eastern Japan in conquest over the Ezo, the condition for assuming office was that he had to be "someone who controls eastern Japan in some form."

A recently popular explanation on the subject is that, since 'Seii Taishogun' was originally a post for leading soldiers of eastern Japan in conquest over the Ezo, the condition for assuming office was that he had to be 'someone who controls eastern Japan in some form.'

sen.j: 織田信長が征夷大将軍を望んでいたか否かは諸説あり、断定できない。
sen.e: There are various opinions as to whether or not ODA Nobunaga wanted to be Seii Taishogun, but it is not possible to know for sure.
There are various opinions as to whether or not Nobunaga ODA wanted to be Seii Taishogun, but it is not possible to know for sure.

sen.j: ただし、征夷大将軍拝命の勅使が来るための条件となったのは、信長が東国の大名である武田氏を滅ぼしたこと、また、関東の北条氏を実質的に臣従させたことなどが根拠（名目）となっていたのではないかとも推察される。
sen.e: Actually, there is some specualation that what became a nominal qualification for the imperial recommendation for appointment to Seii Taishogun was that Nobunaga wiped out the Takeda clan, who were eastern Japan Daimyo, and effectively made the Hojo clan of Kanto subservient.

Actually, there is some speculation that what became a nominal qualification for the imperial recommendation for appointment to Seii Taishogun was that Nobunaga wiped out the Takeda clan, who were eastern Japan Daimyo, and effectively made the Hojo clan of Kanto subservient.

sen.j: また、豊臣秀吉が征夷大将軍になれなかったのは、徳川家康に小牧・長久手の戦いで敗れたためであるという説もある。
sen.e: Also, there are those who say that TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi was not able to become Seii Taishogun because he lost to TOKUGAWA Ieyasu in the battles of Omaki and Nagakute.
Also, there are those who say that Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI was not able to become Seii Taishogun because he lost to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the battles of Komaki and Nagakute.
Also, there are those who say that Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI was not able to become Seii Taishogun because he lost to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the battles of Komaki and Nagakute.

sen.j: だが、秀吉は征夷大将軍より格上の関白に任ぜられた。
sen.e: However, Hideyoshi was appointed to Kanpaku, a higher ranking position than Seii Taishogun.
However, Hideyoshi was appointed to Kanpaku, a higher ranking position than Seii Taishogun.
However, Hideyoshi was appointed to Kampaku, a higher ranking position than Seii Taishogun.

sen.j: そのため、秀吉は将軍職には興味がなく、単なる武家政権ではなく、公家を包括する新政権を志向していたと言う推測も可能である。
sen.e: For that reason, it is possible to speculate that Hideyoshi was not interested in the Shogun post, and wanted not a simple samurai government, but a new government that would subsume the nobles.
For that reason, it is possible to speculate that Hideyoshi was not interested in the Shogun post, and wanted not a simple samurai government, but a new government that would subsumed the nobles.
For that reason, it is possible to speculate that Hideyoshi was not interested in the Shogun post, and wanted not a simple samurai government, but a new government that would subsumed the nobles.

sen.j: 一方、公家の間でもかつては、とある人物の家柄が源氏と平氏のいずれに連なるかにこだわり「公家に近しい平家」「御しがたい武家の源氏」と見なす風潮があった。
sen.e: On the other hand, there was previously, among the nobles, a tendency to view a person's pedigree - whether Minamoto or Taira clan - as "Taira who are close to the nobles" or "the warrior Minamoto clan who are difficult to control."

On the other hand, there was previously, among the nobles, a tendency to view a person's pedigree - whether Minamoto or Taira clan - as 'Taira who are close to the nobles' or 'the warrior Minamoto clan who are difficult to control.'

sen.j: またこれに根ざして、源氏と平氏あるいは源家と平家が日本の政権を交互に執るという思想も生まれた（源平交代思想）。
sen.e: Also stemming from this came the idea that the Minamoto and Taira clans, or the Minamoto and Taira families, alternately take control of political power in Japan (Genpei kotai shiso).
Also stemming from this came the idea that the Minamoto and Taira clans, or the Minamoto and Taira families, alternately take control of political power in Japan (Genpei kotai shiso).
Also stemming from this came the idea that the Minamoto and Taira clans, or the Minamoto and Taira families, alternately take control of political power in Japan (Gempei kotai shiso).

sen.j: なお、平知盛・明智光秀が征夷大将軍に任命されたとの俗説もあるが、それを示す史料はない。
sen.e: Actually, although there is an apocryphal tale that TAIRA no Tomomori and AKECHI Mitsuhide were appointed to Seii Taishogun, there is no historical evidence to indicate so.
Actually, although there is an apocryphal tale that TAIRA no Tomomori and Mitsuhide AKECHI were appointed to Seii Taishogun, there is no historical evidence to indicate so.
In fact, although there is an apocryphal tale that TAIRA no Tomomori and Mitsuhide AKECHI were appointed to Seii Taishogun, there is no historical evidence to indicate so.
